page.title: 14RELIGION
page.content: {Holy Trinity Church, Dacre:}built in 1837, holding services twice each Sunday with 50 attending and a Sunday school for 15 children. {Glasshouses Chapel:}built about 120 years ago with seating for 150.There are services twice on Sunday with a total of about 45 attending with a Sunday school for 16 children held in the Broadbelt Hall, so named after a Glasshouses boy who became a prominent Methodist Minister. {Summerbridge Chapel:}built in 1895 to replace an earlier one; services held twice-weekly for 85 people;a Sunday school for 20 children plus other clubs for all ages. {Wilsill Anglican Church}:built in 1905,seats 60, 30 attend once-weekly.{ {Wilsill Methodist Chapel:}built 78 years ago,seating 90 with services twice every Sunday.
